data.title: “Why not go out on a limb? Isn’t that where the fruit is?” -Frank Scully
data.meta_description: Frank is well-known for his involvement in the Arizona flying saucer hoax in the 1950s and his “non-fiction” book about the incident titled Behind the Flying Saucers. Apart from that excitement, he was a columnist, author and self-termed humorist. Inasmuch as he seems to be a peculiar character, I found his words of wisdom to be inspiring.…
data.text:
Frank is well-known for his involvement in the Arizona flying saucer hoax in the 1950s and his “non-fiction” book about the incident titled Behind the Flying Saucers. Apart from that excitement, he was a columnist, author and self-termed humorist. Inasmuch as he seems to be a peculiar character, I found his words of wisdom to be inspiring.

I happened upon this quote while reading the cap of my Honest Tea. I appreciate the quirky wit of the words. When I go out on a limb for something, I am taking risk whether it comes to fruition or not. When an endeavor is fruitful, a person can reap the benefits of their labor. So why not try? Be daring, be adventurous, go for the fruit!
